body.title: Configuration file basics
body.p: The SPFE configuration file is the core of the SPFE build system. It defines the XML elements that specify the content to include in the documentation set and the scripts to generate the output. You can define a single configuration file for the documentation set; however, unless you have a very simple documentation set, it is usually best to divide the configuration elements into different files and use an include element to import other configuration files. This enables you to maximize reuse and modularity. The set of configuration files makes up the complete set of elements that the build system needs to build the documentation set.

SPFE provides the spfe-config.xsd schema. You can define your own schema, which may include the spfe-config schema and you can add elements that are specific to your documentation set. Each configuration file used to build the documentation set must follow the same schema.

Items that apply to the entire documentation set should be specified in the main configuration file (the file specified as a parameter when you run the spfe build tool). You can override the value of elements as needed in other configuration files.
The following elements must be defined in the main configuration file:

li.p: spfe: The root element of the configuration file; each configuration file must specify this element
doc-set: If you use a documentation set, you must define the elements here

body.p: The following elements are good candidates to specify in the main configuration file:

li.p: topic-type-alias: If you want to specify a user-friendly name for a topic schema and you have multiple topic sets for a topic schema, it is a good idea to define this element in the main configuration file.
